standard_metadata.standard_description: Explain patterns in the number of zeros of the product when multiplying a number by powers of 10, and explain patterns in the placement of the decimal point when a decimal is multiplied or divided by a power of 10. Use whole-number exponents to denote powers of 10.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Multiply and divide decimals by 10, 100, and 1000

hints.content: Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.  Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Ten thousands | Thousands | $,$ | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $37$ |$\blueE{\leftarrow}$ | $\blueE{\leftarrow}$ | | $\blueE{\leftarrow}$ | $3$ | $7$ $37{,}000$ | $3$ | $7$ | $,$ | $0$ | $0$ | $0$  The digits in $37$ moved $3$ place values to the left. So we multiplied $37$ by $3$ factors of $10$.  $\begin{align} 37 \blueE{\times10 \times 10 \times 10} &=37{,}000 \\\\ 37 \blueE{\times1{,}000} &= 37{,}000 \end{align}$

Number | Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths  :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $37$ | $3$ | $7$ |  | $\maroonE{\rightarrow}$ | $\maroonE{\rightarrow}$  $0.37$  || $0$ |$.$ | $3$ | $7$  The digits in $37$ moved $2$ place values to the right. So we divided $37$ by $2$ divisors of $10$.  $\begin{align} 37 \maroonE{\div 10 \div 10 } &=0.37 \\\\ 37 \maroonE{\div 100} &= 0.37 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 37 \blueE{\times1{,}000} &= 37{,}000 \\\\ 37 \maroonE{\div 100} &= 0.37 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.  Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Tens| Ones | $.$| Tenths| Hundredths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $0.09$ | $\blueE{\leftarrow}$ | $\blueE{\leftarrow}$  | $.$| $0$| $9$ $9$ | $0$ | $9$ | $.$ | $0$ | $0$  The digits in $0.09$ moved $2$ place values to the left. So we multiplied $0.09$ by $2$ factors of $10$.  $0.09 \blueE{\times100} = 9$

Number | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths | Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $0.09$ | $0$ | $.$ | $0$ | $9$ | $\maroonE{\rightarrow}$  $0.009$  | $0$ |$.$ | $0$ | $0$ | $9$  The digits in $0.09$ moved $1$ place value to the right. So we divided $0.09$ by $1$ divisor of $10$.  $0.09 \maroonE{\div 10 } =0.009$
$\begin{align} 0.09 \blueE{\times100} &= 9 \\\\ 0.09 \maroonE{\div 10 } &=0.009 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.  Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Hundred Thousands| Ten thousands | Thousands | $,$ | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $142$ |$\blueE{\leftarrow}$ | $\blueE{\leftarrow}$ | $\blueE{\leftarrow}$ | | $1$ | $4$| $2$ $142{,}000$ | $1$ | $4$| $2$ | $,$ | $0$ | $0$ | $0$  The digits in $142$ moved $3$ place values to the left. So we multiplied $142$ by $3$ factors of $10$.  $\begin{align} 142 \blueE{\times10 \times 10 \times 10} &=142{,}000 \\\\ 142 \blueE{\times1{,}000} &= 142{,}000 \end{align}$

Number | Hundreds| Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths  :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $142$ | $1$ | $4$ | $2$|  | $\maroonE{\rightarrow}$  $14.2$  | $0$ |$1$ | $4$ | $.$ | $2$   The digits in $142$ moved $1$ place value to the right. So we divided $142$ by $1$ divisor of $10$.  $\begin{align} 142 \maroonE{\div 10 } &=0.142 \\\\ 142 \maroonE{\div 10} &= 14.2 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 142 \blueE{\times1{,}000} &= 142{,}000\\\\ 142 \maroonE{\div 10} &= 14.2 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.  Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones| $.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $5.6$ |$\blueE{\leftarrow}$ |$\blueE{\leftarrow}$ | $\blueE{\leftarrow}$ |  $5$ | $.$ | $6$  $5{,}600$ | $5$ | $6$ | $0$ | $0$| |  The digits in $5.6$ moved $3$ place values to the left. So we multiplied $5.6$ by $3$ factors of $10$.  $\begin{align} 5.6 \blueE{\times10 \times 10\times 10 } &=5{,}600 \\\\ 5.6  \blueE{\times1{,}000} &= 5{,}600 \end{align}$

Number |Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths | Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $5.6$ | $5$ | $.$ | $6$ | $\maroonE{\rightarrow}$ | $\maroonE{\rightarrow}$  $0.056$  | $0$ |$.$ | $0$ | $5$ | $6$  The digits in $5.6$ moved $2$ place values to the right. So we divided $5.6$ by $2$ divisors of $10$.  $\begin{align} 5.6 \maroonE{\div 10 \div 10 } &=0.056 \\\\ 5.6 \maroonE{\div 100} &= 0.056 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 5.6  \blueE{\times1{,}000} &= 5{,}600 \\\\ 5.6 \maroonE{\div 100} &= 0.056 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.

Number |  Thousands | $,$ | Hundreds | Tens | Ones |$.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $88.5$ |$\blueD{\leftarrow}$ | |$\blueD{\leftarrow}$ | $8$ | $8$| $.$| $5$ $8{,}850$ | $8$ | $,$| $8$ | $5$ | $0$ |  |  The digits in $88.5$ moved $2$ place values to the left. So we multiplied $88.5$ by $2$ factors of $10$.  $\begin{align} 88.5 \blueD{\times10 \times 10} &=8{,}850 \\\\ 88.5 \blueD{\times100} &= 8{,}850 \end{align}$

Number | Ten thousands | Thousands | $,$ | Hundreds | Tens | Ones |$.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $88.5$ |$\greenD{\leftarrow}$ | $\greenD{\leftarrow}$ | |$\greenD{\leftarrow}$ | $8$ | $8$| $.$| $5$ $88{,}500$ | $8$ | $8$| $,$ | $5$ | $0$ | $0$ | |  The digits in $88.5$ moved $3$ place values to the left. So we multiplied $88.5$ by $3$ factors of $10$.  $\begin{align} 88.5 \greenD{\times10 \times 10 \times 10} &=88{,}500 \\\\ 88.5 \greenD{\times1{,}000} &= 88{,}500 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 88.5 \blueD{\times100} &= 8{,}850\\\\ 88.5 \greenD{\times1{,}000} &= 88{,}500 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.

Number | Thousands | $,$ | Hundreds | Tens | Ones |$.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $62.4$ | $\greenD{\leftarrow}$ | |$\greenD{\leftarrow}$ | $6$ | $2$| $.$| $4$ $6{,}240$ | $6$ | $,$| $2$ | $4$ | $0$ |  |   The digits in $62.4$ moved $2$ place values to the left. So we multiplied $62.4$ by $2$ factors of $10$.  $\begin{align} 62.4 \greenD{ \times 10 \times 10} &=6{,}240 \\\\ 62.4 \greenD{\times100} &= 6{,}240 \end{align}$

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones |$.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $62.4$ | $\blueD{\leftarrow}$ | $6$ | $2$| $.$| $4$ $624$ | $6$ | $2$ | $4$ | |    The digits in $62.4$ moved $1$ place value to the left. So we multiplied $62.4$ by $1$ factor of $10$.  $\begin{align} 62.4 \blueD{\times10 } &=624 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 62.4 \greenD{\times100} &= 6{,}240\\\\ 62.4 \blueD{\times10} &= 624 \end{align}$
Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths| Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $9.2$ | $9$ | $.$ | $2$ | $\blueD{\rightarrow}$| $\blueD{\rightarrow}$ $0.092$  | $0$ |$.$| $0$ | $9$ | $2$  The digits in $9.2$ moved $2$ place values to the right. So we divided $9.2$ by $2$ divisors of $10$.  $\begin{align} 9.2\blueD{\div 10 \div 10 } &=0.092 \\\\ 9.2 \blueD{\div 100} &= 0.092 \end{align}$

Number | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $9.2$ | $9$ | $.$ | $2$ | $\greenD{\rightarrow}$ $0.92$  | $0$ |$.$ | $9$ | $2$   The digits in $9.2$ moved $1$ place value to the right. So we divided $9.2$ by $1$ divisor of $10$.  $9.2 \greenD{\div 10} =0.92$
$\begin{align} 9.2 \blueD{\div 100} &= 0.092\\\\ 9.2 \greenD{\div 10} &=0.92 \end{align}$
Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Hundreds| Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths  :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $763$ | $7$ | $6$ | $3$|  | $\greenD{\rightarrow}$  $76.3$  ||$7$| $6$ |$.$ | $3$   The digits in $763$ moved $1$ place value to the right. So we divided $763$ by $1$ divisor of $10$.  $763 \greenD{\div 10} = 76.3$

So we divided $763$ by $3$ divisors of $10$.  $\begin{align} 763 \blueD{\div 10 \div 10 \div 10} &=0.763  \\\\ 763 \blueD{\div 1{,}000} &= 0.763 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 763 \greenD{\div 10} &= 76.3\\\\ 763 \blueD{\div 1{,}000} &= 0.763 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.  Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones | $.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $97.2$ | $\blueD{\leftarrow}$ | $9$ | $7$ | $.$| $2$ $97.2\blueD{\times10}$ | $9$ | $7$ | $2$ | |   When we multiply by $10$, we multiply by $1$ factor of 10. So, $\blueD{97.2}$ moved $1$ place value to the left.  $97.2 \blueD{\times 10} =972$

Number || Tens | Ones | $.$| Tenths | Hundredths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $97.2$ |$\greenD{\rightarrow}$| $9$ | $7$ | $.$| $2$| $97.2\greenD{\div10}$ | | | $9$ | $.$ | $7$ | $2$  When we divide by $10$, we divide by $1$ divisor of 10. So, $\greenD{97.2}$ moved $1$ place value to the right.  $97.2 \greenD{\div 10} =97.2$
$\begin{align} 97.2 \blueD{\times 10} &=972\\\\ 97.2 \greenD{\div 10}& =9.72 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.  Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Thousands| |Hundreds | Tens | Ones  :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $8$ | $\blueD{\leftarrow}$ | |$\blueD{\leftarrow}$| $\blueD{\leftarrow}$ | $8$  $8\blueD{\times10\times10\times10}$ | $8$ | $,$| $0$ | $0$ |$0$   When we multiply by $1{,}000$, we multiply by $3$ factors of 10. So, $\blue8$ moved $3$ place values to the left.  $\begin{align} 8 \blueD{\times 10\times 10\times 10} &=8{,}000\\\\ 8 \blueD{\times 1{,}000} &=8{,}000 \end{align}$

Number |  Ones | $.$| Tenths| Hundredths | Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $8$ | $8$| |  $\greenD{\rightarrow}$ |$\greenD{\rightarrow}$| $\greenD{\rightarrow}$ $8\greenD{\div10\div10\div10}$ | $0$ | $.$| $0$ | $0$ |$8$   When we divide by $1{,}000$, we divide by $3$ divisors of 10. So, $\green8$ moved $3$ place values to the right.  $\begin{align} 8 \greenD{\div 10\div 10\div 10} &=0.008\\\\ 8 \greenD{\div 1{,}000} &=0.008 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 8 \blueD{\times 1{,}000} &=8{,}000\\\\ 8 \greenD{\div 1{,}000} &=0.008 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.  Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Thousands| |Hundreds | Tens | Ones | $.$| Tenths| Hundredths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $154.83$ | $\blueD{\leftarrow}$ | |$1$ | $5$ | $4$| $.$| $8$| $3$ $154.83\blueD{\times10}$ | $1$ | $,$ | $5$ | $4$| $8$ | $.$| $3$ |   When we multiply by $10$, we multiply by $1$ factor of 10. So, $\blueD{154.83}$ moved $1$ place value to the left.  $154.83 \blueD{\times 10} =1{,}548.3$

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones | $.$| Tenths| Hundredths| Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $154.83$ | $1$ | $5$ | $4$| $.$| $8$| $3$ |$\greenD{\rightarrow}$ $154.83\greenD{\div10}$| | $1$ | $5$| $.$| $4$ | $8$| $3$   When we divide by $10$, we divide by $1$ divisor of 10. So, $\greenD{154.83}$ moved $1$ place value to the right.  $154.83 \greenD{\div 10} = 15.483$
$\begin{align} 154.83 \blueD{\times 10} &=1{,}548.3\\\\ 154.83 \greenD{\div 10} &=15.483 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.  Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Hundreds| Tens | Ones |$.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $0.6$ | $\blueD{\leftarrow}$| $\blueD{\leftarrow}$ | $0$ | $.$| $6$  $0.6\blueD{\times10\times10}$ | | $6$ | $0$| |   When we multiply by $100$, we multiply by $2$ factors of 10. So, $\blue{0.6}$ moved $2$ place values to the left.  $\begin{align} 0.6 \blueD{\times 10\times 10} &=60\\\\ 0.6 \blueD{\times 100} &=60 \end{align}$

Number | Ones |$.$| Tenths| Hundredths| Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $0.6$ | $0$ | $.$| $6$| $\greenD{\rightarrow}$| $\greenD{\rightarrow}$  $0.6\greenD{\div10\div10}$ | $0$| $.$ | $0$| $0$| $6$   When we divide by $100$, we divide by $2$ divisors of 10. So, $\green{0.6}$ moved $2$ place values to the right.  $\begin{align} 0.6 \greenD{\div 10\div 10} &=0.006\\\\ 0.6 \greenD{\div 100} &=0.006 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 0.6 \blueD{\times 100} &=60\\\\ 0.6 \greenD{\div 100} &=0.006 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.

Number | Ones |$.$| Tenths| Hundredths| Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $0.554$ | $\maroonD{\leftarrow}$ | $.$| $5$| $5$| $4$ $0.554\maroonD{\times10}$ | $5$ | $.$| $5$| $4$  |    When we multiply by $10$, we multiply by $1$ factor of $10$. So, $\maroonD{0.554}$ moved $1$ place value to the left.  $0.554 \maroonD{\times 10} =5.54$

Number | Tens | Ones |$.$| Tenths| Hundredths| Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $0.554$ | $\greenD{\leftarrow}$| $\greenD{\leftarrow}$ | $.$| $5$| $5$| $4$ $0.554\greenD{\times10\times10}$ | $5$ | $5$| $.$| $4$  | |   When we multiply by $100$, we multiply by $2$ factors of $10$. So, $\green{0.554}$ moved $2$ place values to the left.  $\begin{align} 0.554 \greenD{\times 10\times 10} &=55.4\\\\ 0.554 \greenD{\times 100} &=55.4 \end{align}$

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones |$.$| Tenths| Hundredths| Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $0.554$ | $\blueD{\leftarrow}$ |$\blueD{\leftarrow}$| $\blueD{\leftarrow}$ | $.$| $5$| $5$| $4$ $0.554\blueD{\times10\times10\times10}$ | $5$ | $5$| $4$ | | | |   When we multiply by $1{,}000$, we multiply by $3$ factors of $10$. So, $\blue{0.554}$ moved $3$ place values to the left.  $\begin{align} 0.554 \blueD{\times 10\times 10\times 10} &=554\\\\ 0.554 \blueD{\times 1{,}000} &=554 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 0.554 \maroonD{\times 10} &=5.54\\\\ 0.554 \greenD{\times 100} &=55.4\\\\ 0.554 \blueD{\times 1{,}000} &=554 \end{align}$
Multiplying by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the left**.

Number | Hundreds| Tens| Ones |$.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $16.2$ | $\maroonD{\leftarrow}$ | $1$| $6$| $.$| $2$ $16.2\maroonD{\times10}$ | $1$ | $6$| $2$|   |    When we multiply by $10$, we multiply by $1$ factor of $10$. So, $\maroonD{16.2}$ moved $1$ place value to the left.  $16.2 \maroonD{\times 10} =162$

Number | Thousands| |Hundreds| Tens| Ones |$.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $16.2$ | $\greenD{\leftarrow}$| |$\greenD{\leftarrow}$ | $1$| $6$| $.$| $2$ $16.2\greenD{\times10\times10}$ | $1$ | $,$|  $6$| $2$|$0$ | |   When we multiply by $100$, we multiply by $2$ factors of $10$. So, $\green{16.2}$ moved $2$ place values to the left.  $\begin{align} 16.2 \greenD{\times 10\times 10} &=1{,}620\\\\ 16.2 \greenD{\times 100} &=1{,}620 \end{align}$

Number | Ten Thousands| Thousands| |Hundreds | Tens | Ones |$.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $16.2$  |$\blueD{\leftarrow}$ |$\blueD{\leftarrow}$| |$\blueD{\leftarrow}$ | $1$| $6$| $.$| $2$ $16.2\blueD{\times10\times10\times10}$ | $1$ | $6$| $,$ | $2$|$0$ |$0$ | |   When we multiply by $1{,}000$, we multiply by $3$ factors of $10$. So, $\blueD{16.2}$ moved $3$ place values to the left.  $\begin{align} 16.2 \blueD{\times 10\times 10\times 10} &=16,200\\\\ 16.2 \blueD{\times 1{,}000} &=16,200 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 16.2 \maroonD{\times 10} &=162\\\\ 16.2 \greenD{\times 100} &=1{,}620\\\\ 16.2 \blueD{\times 1{,}000} &=16,200 \end{align}$
Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Tens| Ones |$.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $30$ | $3$| $0$| | $\maroonD{\rightarrow}$ $30\maroonD{\div10}$ |  | $3$| $.$| $0$  When we divide by $10$, we divide by $1$ divisor of $10$. So, $\maroonD{30}$ moved $1$ place value to the right.  $30 \maroonD{\div 10} =3$

Number | Tens| Ones |$.$| Tenths| Hundredths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $30$  | $3$| $0$| |$\greenD{\rightarrow}$ |$\greenD{\rightarrow}$ $30\greenD{\div10\div10}$ | |$0$| $.$| $3$| $0$ When we divide by $100$, we divide by $2$ divisors of $10$. So, $\green{30}$ moved $2$ place values to the right.  $\begin{align} 30 \greenD{\div 10\div 10} &=0.30\\\\ 30 \greenD{\div 100} &=0.3 \end{align}$

Number | Tens | Ones | $.$| Tenths| Hundredths| Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $30$   | $3$| $0$| | $\blueD{\rightarrow}$ |$\blueD{\rightarrow}$| $\blueD{\rightarrow}$ $30\blueD{\div10\div10\div10}$| | $0$ | $.$ | $0$|$3$ |$0$  When we divide by $1{,}000$, we divide by $3$ divisors of $10$. So, $\blueD{30}$ moved $3$ place values to the right.  $\begin{align} 30 \blueD{\div 10\div 10\div 10} &=0.03\\\\ 30 \blueD{\div 1{,}000} &=0.03 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 30 \maroonD{\div 10} &=3\\\\ 30 \greenD{\div 100} &=0.3\\\\ 30 \blueD{\div 1{,}000} &=0.03 \end{align}$
Dividing by ${10}$ moves every digit **one place value to the right**.

Number | Tens| Ones |$.$| Tenths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $97$ | $9$| $7$| | $\maroonD{\rightarrow}$ $97\maroonD{\div10}$ |  | $9$| $.$| $7$  When we divide by $10$, we divide by $1$ divisor of $10$. So, $\maroonD{97}$ moved $1$ place value to the right.  $97 \maroonD{\div 10} =9.7$

Number | Tens| Ones |$.$| Tenths| Hundredths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $97$  | $9$| $7$| |$\greenD{\rightarrow}$ |$\greenD{\rightarrow}$ $97\greenD{\div10\div10}$ | |$0$| $.$| $9$| $7$ When we divide by $100$, we divide by $2$ divisors of $10$. So, $\green{97}$ moved $2$ place values to the right.  $\begin{align} 97 \greenD{\div 10\div 10} &=0.97\\\\ 97 \greenD{\div 100} &=0.97 \end{align}$

Number | Tens | Ones | $.$| Tenths| Hundredths| Thousandths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $97$   | $9$| $7$| | $\blueD{\rightarrow}$ |$\blueD{\rightarrow}$| $\blueD{\rightarrow}$ $97\blueD{\div10\div10\div10}$| | $0$ | $.$ | $0$|$9$ |$7$  When we divide by $1{,}000$, we divide by $3$ divisors of $10$. So, $\blueD{97}$ moved $3$ place values to the right.  $\begin{align} 97 \blueD{\div 10\div 10\div 10} &=0.097\\\\ 97 \blueD{\div 1{,}000} &=0.097 \end{align}$
$\begin{align} 97 \maroonD{\div 10} &=9.7\\\\ 97 \greenD{\div 100} &=0.97\\\\ 97 \blueD{\div 1{,}000} &=0.097 \end{align}$
